descriptions: The project website (created from ground up for this project), Kleinkram data sharing web interface, localization benchmark interface via eval.ai for the GrandTour dataset
Kleinkram web interface, GrandTour Dataset Webpage

grand_tour_box: Main repository that contains the pre- and post- processing scripts, grand_tour_dataset: Contains simple examples on how to use the data and acts as a bridge between the developer team and the public, grand_tour_webpage: Front-end HTML for the webpage. Webpage itself is available to the public, grand_tour_benchmark: Backend for the localization benchmark. The benchmark itself is available to the public
The GrandTour Dataset. This is one of the main contributions of the project. The data is stored in the ETH Zurich server and accessible through the “Kleinkram” interface.
GrandTour dataset: Data collected with the GrandTour SensorBox in over 100 environments
Data verification utilities (e.g., tools for matching gyroscope angular velocity), additional data post-processing modules extending existing software.
Kleinkram: A structured bag and mcap storage solution with a python CLI
Boxi software (code for Boxi sensor payload)
The dataset will be presented at a conference workshop at IEEE ICRA 2026 in Vienna.
Collaboration with Leica Geosystems involving training on their devices and tutorials on robotic sensing integration with Robot Operating System.

A technical report of one of the data collection expeditions, A journal publication in International Journal of Robotics Research (IJRR) is currently underway, describing the dataset in question, A major publication, already accepted, describing the software & hardware and the motivation of the dataset collection.
Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics. Robotics: Science and Systems Conference (RSS 2025)
Accepted publication titled 'Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics' to be presented at RSS 2025 conference, June 20th-25th.
Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics – RSS 2025 Poster Session
Organize a workshop in IEEE ICRA 2026 to bring together researchers from different robotics domains and discuss dataset/benchmark results; planned online seminar series about data usage.
ANYmal Research: A place to discuss about ANYmal. 307 Members 2 Admins 3 Moderators; community research support
Collaboration with University of Oxford, ORI-DRS lab under Prof. Maurice Fallon to extend the GrandTour dataset with overlapping regions of interest with established datasets.
Collaborating with Leica Geosystems and Hexagon to utilize their devices for robotics and to extend the dataset.
Collaboration with Leica Geosystems for the co-development of Boxi sensor payload
ANYmal Research community already 300+ active members; with planned IEEE ICRA 2026 Workshop, plan to reach a wider baseline of community.
307 members in the ANYmal Research community potentially benefiting from ORD practices

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  REPORT OUTPUT FOCUS:
  - 15 standard output categories in "List of Outputs" table
  - Each category: quantity number, descriptions list, URLs list
  - Separate descriptions from URLs even when mixed in same cell
  - Academic collaborations vs Industrial partnerships (distinct categories)
  - Preserve all detailed descriptions and web addresses
